solution_line_template: There are {sq_m_per_hectare}m^2 in each hectare, so {total_hectares} hectares contains {total_hectares}*{sq_m_per_hectare} = <<{total_hectares}*{sq_m_per_hectare}={total_land_sq_m}>>{total_land_sq_m}m^2 of land
{total_land_sq_m}m^2 is divided among {num_sons} sons so each son will get {total_land_sq_m}/{num_sons} = <<{total_land_sq_m}/{num_sons}={land_per_son_sq_m}>>{land_per_son_sq_m}m^2

In every {land_per_son_sq_m}m^2, there are {land_per_son_sq_m}/{profit_area_unit} = <<{land_per_son_sq_m}/{profit_area_unit}={num_profit_portions_per_son}>>{num_profit_portions_per_son} portions of {profit_area_unit}m^2 areas of land

Each son can make {num_profit_portions_per_son}*${profit_per_portion} = $<<{num_profit_portions_per_son}*{profit_per_portion}={profit_per_son_per_3_months}>>{profit_per_son_per_3_months} every 3 months from cultivating their share

In one year there are {months_per_year} months so each son can make ${profit_per_son_per_3_months} up to {months_per_year}/{profit_period_months} = <<{months_per_year}/{profit_period_months}={num_profit_periods_per_year}>>{num_profit_periods_per_year} times in a year

Each son can make a total of ${profit_per_son_per_3_months}*{num_profit_periods_per_year} = $<<{profit_per_son_per_3_months}*{num_profit_periods_per_year}={total_profit_per_son_per_year}>>{total_profit_per_son_per_year} in a year
